title: Providing an Order of Succession Within the Department of Agriculture

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes the sequence of officials within the Department of Agriculture who will take over as Acting Secretary if both the Secretary and Deputy Secretary are unable to perform their duties. It also revokes a previous order on this succession and clarifies conditions under which individuals can serve as Acting Secretary.
potential_concerns: The order-of-succession may create ambiguity or delays in leadership during a crisis, potentially impacting rural communities and agricultural-workers who rely on stable Department of Agriculture guidance.

The inclusion of State Executive Directors from specific Midwestern states (Kansas, Missouri, Iowa) in the line of succession may raise concerns about regional bias affecting national agricultural policy and rural development priorities.

Restrictions preventing acting officials serving in an acting capacity from becoming Acting Secretary could limit leadership options during an emergency, possibly disrupting government efficiency within the Department of Agriculture.

The President's discretionary authority to deviate from the established succession order could lead to concerns about transparency and politicization affecting stakeholders in agricultural policy and rural development.
